org.streaminer.util.distance

Class LinearDistance

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.streaminer.util.distance.LinearDistance

  • public class LinearDistance
extends Object
    This class gives some static methods concerning amount distance of vectors. A vector has to be a List of Double. Moreover vectors must have the same dimension to be compared so a RuntimeException will be thrown if dimensions of vectors don't fit.
    Author:
    Daniel Haak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      LinearDistance()

      Given a comparator and a list of vectors this method determines which vector has the greatest distance to the comparator.

      Given a comparator and a list of vectors this method determines which vector is closest to the comparator.

      This method returns the pair out of a list of vectors that have the furthest distance.

    • Method Detail

      • distanceBetween

        public static <T extends List<Double>> Double distanceBetween(T firstVector,
                                              T secondVector)
        The amount distance between two vectors can be computed using this method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - extends List of Double
        Parameters:
        firstVector - - List of Double representing a vector
        secondVector - - List of Double representing a vector
        Returns:
        distance of two vectors represented by a Double value
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if dimension of firstVector and secondVector are different

      • getFarestVector

        public static <T extends List<Double>> T getFarestVector(List<T> vectors,
                                         T comparator)
        Given a comparator and a list of vectors this method determines which vector has the greatest distance to the comparator.
        Type Parameters:
        T - extends List of Double
        Parameters:
        vectors - - a List containing Lists of Double each representing a vector
        comparator - - List of Double representing a vector
        Returns:
        List of Double which represents the vector with furthest distance to comparator
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if dimension of firstVector and secondVector are different

      • getNearestVector

        public static <T extends List<Double>> T getNearestVector(List<T> vectors,
                                          T comparator)
        Given a comparator and a list of vectors this method determines which vector is closest to the comparator.
        Type Parameters:
        T - extends List of Double
        Parameters:
        vectors - - a List containing Lists of Double each representing a vector
        comparator - - List of Double representing a vector
        Returns:
        List of Double which represents the vector with smallest distance to comparator
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if dimension of firstVector and secondVector are different

      • getPairWithSmallestDistance

        public static <T extends List<Double>> List<T> getPairWithSmallestDistance(List<T> vectors)
        This method returns the pair out of a list of vectors that have the closest distance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - extends List of Double
        Parameters:
        vectors - - a List containing Lists of Double each representing a vector
        Returns:
        List containing two List of Double representing the two closest vectors
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if dimension of firstVector and secondVector are different or list of vectors contains less than two elements

      • getPairWithFurthestDistance

        public static <T extends List<Double>> List<T> getPairWithFurthestDistance(List<T> vectors)
        This method returns the pair out of a list of vectors that have the furthest distance.
        Type Parameters:
        T - extends List of Double
        Parameters:
        vectors - - a List containing Lists of Double each representing a vector
        Returns:
        List containing two List of Double representing the two vectors with greatest distance.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if dimension of firstVector and secondVector are different or list of vectors contains less than two elements
